meanings.definition: Incorrectly given as a reward or recognition.
meanings.sent1: The misawarded trophy had the wrong name on it.
meanings.sent2: The misawarded certificate caused confusion among the students.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a misawarded medal mix-up at the school event.
meanings.sent4: The misawarded prize felt like a joke to the disappointed winner.
meanings.sent5: The misawarded title made everyone question the judge's decision.

meanings.definition: To wrongly bestow an award or honor.
meanings.sent1: The judge misawarded the first place to the wrong contestant.
meanings.sent2: She misawarded the scholarship to a student who didn't meet the criteria.
meanings.sent3: The mayor accidentally misawarded the key to the city to a tourist.
meanings.sent4: The teacher misawarded extra credit to the student who didn't deserve it.
meanings.sent5: The committee misawarded the contract to the least qualified company.
